snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday’s selections include a battery-powered exoskeleton for the legs that can help elderly or disabled people walk, and people who buy...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday’s selections include a battery-powered exoskeleton for the legs that can help elderly or disabled people walk, and people who buy cellphones in bulk from thieves to be sold around the world.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Robot Legs Pass Test, and Going Global With Stolen Phones
